data.shownotes: This show featured the debuts of Some Context, Welcome to an Altered Future, Digital Black, and Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg. Billabong Valley was dedicated to Charles Bradley, who had passed that day. Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer was played for the first time known since 2015-09-11. (174 show gap) Robot Stop contained a Master Of The Universe' jam with lyrics.

Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and Rolling Stoned. Countdown was performed without the keyboard solo as the band forgot to play it. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. The Lord of Lightning, Sleep Drifter, Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer, Robot Stop, Countdown and Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and Rolling Stoned. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Rattlesnake, Countdown and Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The first performance of Rolling Stoned was played as the last song of Mild High Club's set, with the members of King Gizzard joining in mid-song. Robot Stop contained a Master of the Universe jam with lyrics. Members of Mild High Club joined the band for Countdown and the second performance of Rolling Stoned. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Sleep Drifter, Rattlesnake, Lonely Steel Sheet Flyer, Robot Stop through Gamma Knife, Countdown and both performances of Rolling Stoned were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.
The band walked out to Let There Be Rock by AC/DC.
Robot Stop contained a Master Of The Universe jam with lyrics.
Am I In Heaven? contained People Vultures, Cut Throat Boogie, Rattlesnake, Alter Me, Robot Stop, Cellophane, I'm In Your Mind, Head On/Pill, and Float Along - Fill Your Lungs teases and quotes.

This was an appearance for radio station KEXP in Seattle. The performance was held for a live audience at the KEXP Gathering Space and was hosted by KEXP DJ Cheryl Waters. Han-Tyumi, The Confused Cyborg featured Stu on flute and alternate lyrics.

I'm In Your Mind Fuzz was played for the first time known since 2016-08-19. (106 show gap) Crumbling Castle was played for the first time known since 2016-09-08. (88 show gap) Robot Stop contained a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro.

KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle was confirmed by video. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net

Headline set at Gizzfest Sydney 2017. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and a Master of The Universe jam with lyrics. Doom City contained a Crumbling Castle outro. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. The songs were confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.
Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2017-12-02. (57 show gap)

Am I In Heaven? contained Alter Me I, Hot Water, Head On/Pill, Stressin' and Robot Stop teases and quotes. Muddy Water featured Adam Halliwell on flute. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete, but only partial recordings are available. Venusian 2, Am I In Heaven?, This Thing, Work This Time, Cyboogie, Altered Beast IV, Muddy Water, Melting and Self-Immolate have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers before and as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. This Thing was introduced as a song about Joeys mom. Boogieman Sam was dedicated to their sound tech "Sammy José". Cyboogie was introduced as a song about Stu's grandma by Joey, with him also asking the audience for respect to let Stu sing about his grandma. After Cyboogie, Joey thanked openers ORB and Stonefield.

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases. Wah Wah contained The River quotes. During The Cruel Millennial and The Wheel, Ambrose wore an audience member's fishie helmet. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Planet B and Plastic Boogie through Self-Immolate were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band came on stage. Joey dedicated Cyboogie to "the internet". Boogieman Sam was dedicated to "Sammy Boy". The Bitter Boogie contained Cyboogie teases, Cut Throat Boogie quotes and teases, and Boogieman Sam quotes. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live in Asheville ‘19. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Only Part I of The River was performed and it contained Wah Wah teases.  Wah Wah contained a The River tease. Altered Beast IV contained an Altered Beast I quote. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Am I In Heaven contained an Alter Me I tease and quote, and Boogieman Sam and Robot Stop teases. Perihelion was on the physical setlist after Self-Immolate but was skipped due to time

Poster By Jason Galea
Edition of 100

Evil Star was played through the PA speakers as the band went on stage. Cut Throat Boogie contained a Cruel Millennial outro. Road Train featured in the Chunky Shrapnel album. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist is believed to be complete. Self-Immolate through Cut Throat Boogie, Inner Cell, Horology, Road Train and The River were confirmed by audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 200

The River contained Wah Wah teases and quotes. Am I in Heaven? contained Cellophane and Cyboogie teases, and a Head on Pill jam. Venusian 2 through Sense was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Brussels ‘19. Cavs’s drum solo during ‘Open Water’ is featured in the ‘Chunky Shrapnel’ album under the name 'Parking'. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. All songs besides Doom City have been confirmed via audio/video recordings, and The River is incomplete. Doom City has been confirmed through contemporaneous discussions through various social media. Any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 400

Her and I contained Hell's Itch teases.  After The Fourth Colour, Joey asks the crowd to “take a step back”. The Grim Reaper contained Sadie Sorceress quotes. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2019-10-08 (96 show gap). Evil Death Roll contained Alter Me teases, Hell's Itch teases and a Hypertension Jam, which would debut properly the following night.

Poster By Arash Zarifian
Standard 250 / 30 Foil Prints

“Theme from Halloween” was played over the PA prior to the costumed band members walking on stage to a song played over the PA: "P.I.M.P" (50 Cent) for Ambrose, dressed as a pimp, "Mother" (Danzig) for Cavs, dressed as Glenn Danzig, "You've Got a Friend in Me" (Randy Newman) for Lucas, dressed as Buzz Lightyear, ""C" is for Cookie" (Sesame Street) for Cook, dressed as a cookie, with him throwing cookies into the crowd, "Oompa Loompa (#1)" (Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory) for Joey, dressed as an Oompa Loompa, and "Hollaback Girl" (Gwen Stefani) for Stu, dressed as a banana and throwing bananas into the crowd. Additionally, crew for the show were dressed as ketchup and mustard bottles. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Alter Me was teased during the intro to People-Vultures. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Before Alter Me II, there was an extended discussion about bananas. Alter Me II through Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior (dressed as a witch) providing the narration. The verses were sung out of order in Altered Beast IV. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Doom City, Stu denied a fan request for Catching Smoke saying that they didn’t know how to play it. Magenta Mountain featured a lyric change to reference Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. Stu removed the banana costume prior to Self-Immolate and threw it into the crowd, citing that it was “too hot”. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band in which Ambrose destroyed pumpkins that were on stage and threw the pieces into the crows. Poster by Jake Foreman

Vomit Coffin featured the now-infamous “Amby Snot Rocket”. Blame It on the Weather was humorously announced as the “complete opposite style of music” to the show-opening Murder of the Universe suite. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Cut Throat Boogie was announced as a song about Ambrose getting stabbed in the neck with a broken bottle. Wah Wah began with the intro to The River and subsequently featured The River quotes and teases, as well as a jam. Sadie Sorceress featured an additional verse from The Grim Reaper played over the music to Sadie Sorceress. Joey requested the cameraperson zoom in to his face as close as possible during the intro to Self-Immolate and introduced Cavs as “John Henry Bonham”, followed by a drum solo and a “Moby Dick” (Led Zeppelin) tease, plus an additional brief drum solo and “Moby Dick” tease at the end of the song. Before Her and I (Slow Jam 2), the weather was discussed and the band’s ignorance regarding Fahrenheit to Celsius conversions was revealed. The song itself featured a Flamethrower jam, Slow Jam 1 and Magma teases, and a brief Cut Throat Boogie jam. Hot Wax was dedicated to one of the band's sound engineers, Joe Santarpia. Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Head On/Pill opened with “The Star-Spangled Banner” intro, contained Hypertension teases and a Witchcraft tease, and was unfinished leading into Am I in Heaven?. Venusian 1 closed with a Cavs drum solo which led into Venusian 2. Ambrose introduced Billabong Valley as being about a bushranger and is interrupted by Joey calling him “mad-cunt Morgan”. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was announced as a song about Ambrose’s somewhat troubled upbringing and was dedicated to Edith, Ambrose’s sister. Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior providing the narration. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Tetrachromacy and Hypertension were on the printed setlist but cut due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea Second Edition of Poster

The Wheel was played for the first time since Dec. 19, 2021 (94 show gap). Alter Me III contained Witchcraft teases. Altered Beast IV contained Converge teases. Sadie Sorceress was dedicated to Ambrose's 99-year-old grandmother and contained an extra verse from The Grim Reaper and quotes of Torture Chamber. Am I In Heaven? contained “animals in Australia” lyrics, Witchcraft teases, Head On/Pill teases, Ice V teases, Hot Water teases, Shanghai teases, The Dripping Tap teases, I Am Not a Man Unless I Have a Woman quotes and Sea of Trees teases. Poster By Jason Galea 100 Standard / 30 Foil

Altered Beast III, Alter Me III and Altered Beast IV were played for the first time since 2023-03-23 (115 shows).  Before Stressin', Stu teased Bullet in the Head (Rage Against The Machine). The Book was introduced a song about ancient stuff and featured a short drum solo. Hot Water was played in an alternate synth version for the first time. After Mirage City, Joey shouted out opener King Stingray and thanked guitarist Roy Kellaway for the Yothu Yindi shirt he was wearing. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Crumbling Castle teases and Alter Me teases and quotes. Sea of Trees contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases, Ice V teases, an Alter Me outro, and the second verse was changed to "I'm feeling kinda shit... but I've got my mates with me and I guess that is that, that’s that". Work This Time contained Mars For The Rich teases.

Show poster by Jason Galea - Edition of 100

Oddlife was introduced as Cookie's favorite song. Sense was performed in it's synth arrangement and contained The Grim Reaper teases. The Grim Reaper contained Intergalactic, Sabotage, and (You Gotta) Fight for Your Right (To Party!) (all by the Beastie Boys) quotes, and at the end of the song Ambrose thanked the Beastie Boys. Wah Wah contained a The River intro with Crumbling Castle teases and the song itself contained The River quotes, Crumbling Castle teases and Extinction teases and quotes. Let Me Mend The Past, which contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote, was dedicated to Amby's hangover anxieties. Hypertension contained Extinction teases and quotes. Alter Me (unnumbered) was on the setlist before Altered Beast IV but was not played.

Altered Beast I contained an Alter Me intro.  Alter Me II was played for the first time since 2022-10-31 (177 shows) and contained Hypertension quotes and teases and Forty Six & 2 (Tool) teases. Altered Beast IV contained Hypertension teases.  Hypertension contained Riff Raff (AC/DC), Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Sad Pilot teases. Muddy Water and The Bitter Boogie were performed as a mashup with parts of each song interspersed throughout the other.  Sad Pilot contained teases of The Bitter Boogie and Machine Gun (Jimi Hendrix).  The band's guitar tech Gaspard, introduced as Gary, played drums on Le Risque while Cavs performed his verse from the front of the stage and stayed on drums for the rest of the song.  Motor Spirit was introduced as a song about cars.  Ambrose quoted The Next Episode (Dr. Dre & Snoop Dogg) in Motor Spirit after the band took shots following Gila Monster. At the end of the show the band shouted out opener Barkaa and Joey said "from the river to the sea, free Palestine."  The written setlist had Raw Feel listed as Raw Phil, Muddy Water and The Bitter Boogie listed as Muddy Boogie // Bitter Water, Sad Pilot listed as Rad Pilot and Hot Wax listed as Hot Phacts.
